Dear All Salespeople in HKBN,

Thank you for your new offer for internet service. As we have 5 internet service providers for just 1 contract, we will not be able to engage with you all personally, but we do want to offer some insights for your customer service.

At school, you are normally boxed into a scoring framework of 100 points. As you enter the work force, break free from this limitation and set your own denominator. At school we are taught to try our best to reach the perfect score "100 out of 100 points". In the real world, it Is far better and far easier to score "150 out of 200 points" than "100 out of 100 points", i.e. break free from the box and dare to aim much higher.

Back to internet service plan you offered, instead of just sending us a standard plan, submit something that will WOW us, even if we did not ask for it as this will be the only way to stand out from the 5 internet service providers. When we shortlist service plan, we focus far more on the internet experience than your gift packs and the standard promotion format. A "mass mail" standard offer without custom service details will just go direct to the trash bin, as this is an indicator of a lack of real interest in customer service. A bad service plan offer simply says how good you are and how interested you are in providing customer service. A great service plan explains why your strengths are relevant to internet experience and how these skills can contribute to internet experience.

If you make our shortlist of the top, please do your homework before offering a service plan. Beyond reading our service contracts and comments (which are always negatively biased towards you), study our infrastructure, your competitors' offers and websites (they tend to counter balance your view on them), etc. and give us concrete ideas on areas that you can improve. Don't come to contact us to just promote, rather come to WOW us, otherwise you will be lost amongst the 5 internet service providers. Of course, if you made our top selection, chances are that you will receive better customer satisfaction.

For internet experience, we are fighting the legacy incumbent that is 10x our internet speed, so we are looking for Service which is 10x faster than average. From customer’s point of view, we say don't waste time offering me "my mother is a woman" plan, rather tell me why "my mother is beautiful".

Good luck and I look forward to seeing better service plan offer at the next End-of-Contract period.

Sincerely yours,
XXX
Long-term customer of HKBN

Thank you for your new offer for internet service. As we have 5 internet service providers for just 1 contract, we will not be able to engage with you all personally, but we do want to offer some insights for your customer service.

At school, you are normally boxed into a scoring framework of 100 points. As you enter the work force, break free from this limitation and set your own denominator. At school we are taught to try our best to reach the perfect score "100 out of 100 points". In the real world, it Is far better and far easier to score "150 out of 200 points" than "100 out of 100 points", i.e. break free from the box and dare to aim much higher.

Back to internet service plan you offered, instead of just sending us a standard plan, submit something that will WOW us, even if we did not ask for it as this will be the only way to stand out from the 5 internet service providers. When we shortlist service plan, we focus far more on the internet experience than your gift packs and the standard promotion format. A "mass mail" standard offer without custom service details will just go direct to the trash bin, as this is an indicator of a lack of real interest in customer service. A bad service plan offer simply says how good you are and how interested you are in providing customer service. A great service plan explains why your strengths are relevant to internet experience and how these skills can contribute to internet experience.

If you make our shortlist of the top, please do your homework before offering a service plan. Beyond reading our service contracts and comments (which are always negatively biased towards you), study our infrastructure, your competitors' offers and websites (they tend to counter balance your view on them), etc. and give us concrete ideas on areas that you can improve. Don't come to contact us to just promote, rather come to WOW us, otherwise you will be lost amongst the 5 internet service providers. Of course, if you made our top selection, chances are that you will receive better customer satisfaction.

For internet experience, we are fighting the legacy incumbent that is 10x our internet speed, so we are looking for Service which is 10x faster than average. From customer’s point of view, we say don't waste time offering me "my mother is a woman" plan, rather tell me why "my mother is beautiful".

Good luck and I look forward to seeing better service plan offer at the next End-of-Contract period.

Sincerely yours,
XXX
Long-term customer of HKBN
